title: Facebook invests in Indonesia's ride-hailing firm Gojek but doesn't reveal its stake
text: Facebook did not disclose the size of its investment but said in a blog post on Tuesday evening that the investment underscores its efforts to help bring small businesses online.

title: Facebook and PayPal invest in Southeast Asian ride-hailing giant GoJek
text: Facebook and PayPal have made investments in GoJek, joining Google and Tencent among other high-profile technology companies that have backed the Southeast Asian ride-hailing firm. Facebook, for which it is the first investment in an Indonesia-based firm, and PayPal did not disclose the size of their checks.

title: Facebook Employees Criticize Zuckerberg's Inaction Over Trump
text: David Kirkpatrick, founder of Techonomy, discusses Facebook employees' anger at Mark Zuckerberg.

title: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg Defends Trump Post Decisions to Staff
text: Facebook Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg told staff at a company-wide meeting that he won’t change his mind about a decision to leave up posts shared by U.S. President Donald Trump last week that many workers felt violated the company’s policies against violent rhetoric. Kurt Wagner reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia."

title: Free speech fight at Facebook
text: Danny Fortson, The Sunday Times, and Nilay Patel, The Verge, discuss Facebook and the fight over President Trump's posts.

title: Mark Zuckerberg defends decision to allow Trump to threaten violence on Facebook
text: CEO says decision was ‘tough’ but ‘thorough’ as company faces harsh criticism and public dissent from employees

title: Employee backlash rocks Facebook, and everything else you missed in business news: CNBC After Hours
text: CNBC.com's MacKenzie Sigalos brings you the day's top business news headlines, and what to watch as the coronavirus pandemic continues to keep most of America on lockdown.

title: Why Talkspace Ended Its Partnership with Facebook
text: Oren Frank, chief executive officer at Talkspace , discusses the decision he took to end the partnership between the text therapy company and Facebook.

title: Right now, Facebook can be as despicable as they want: Kara Swisher
text: Recode co-founder Kara Swisher gives her thoughts on what's going on at Facebook, as well as the company's 'hands-off' approach to the president's posts.

title: Zuckerberg firm in decision to allow controversial Trump posts on Facebook
text: Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday defended what he called a “tough decision” to allow controversial posts from President Trump to remain on Facebook. In an internal call with employees, Zuckerberg said that he was “pretty thorough” when reviewing Facebook’s policies regarding Trump’s posts — specifically one that had been flagged by rival Twitter for “glorifying violence”.

title: Facebook workers stage virtual walkout over President Trump's posts about protestors
text: Yahoo Finance’s Dan Howley joins Kristin Myers to discuss Facebook employees conducting a virtual walkout over Mark Zuckerberg allowing President Trump's comments about protestors to remain on Facebook and Instagram.

title: The Facebook CEO defends his inaction on incendiary Trump posts to outraged staff
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg sought to ease the outrage from a number of employees on Tuesday over his inaction on incendiary remarks recently posted by President Donald Trump on the platform.

title: Facebook Engineer Publicly Resigns Over Zuckerberg’s Handling Of Trump Posts
text: “Mark always told us that he would draw the line at speech that calls for violence. He showed us on Friday that this was a lie,” the engineer said.

title: Zuckerberg defends Facebook stance on Trump posts: report
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +0.34% Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday defended his decision to leave alone inflammatory posts by President Donald Trump on the social-networking platform despite criticism from employees and civil rights leaders.

title: After Facebook staff walkout, Zuckerberg defends no action on Trump posts
text: Facebook  CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees on Tuesday that he stood by his decision not to challenge inflammatory posts by U.S. President Donald Trump, refusing to give ground a day after staff members staged a rare public protest.

title: Facebook Stockholders Shouldn’t Be Scared By Section 230 Talk
text:
The potential loss of the company's legal protections shouldn't have a lasting impact on the price of FB stock.
The post Facebook Stockholders Shouldn’t Be Scared By Section 230 Talk appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Facebook engineer quits over Zuckerberg’s policy on Trump posts
text: A Facebook employee has resigned in protest of Mark Zuckerberg’s decision to allow controversial posts from President Trump to remain on the site. In a public post on LinkedIn, software engineer Timothy Aveni said he is on the lookout for a new job thanks to “Facebook’s continued refusal to act on the president’s bigoted messages.

title: Zuckerberg stands firm in refusal to moderate Trump despite employee walkouts and resignations
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Tuesday told employees he was standing firm in the company's decision not to moderate a post in which President Trump said "when the looting starts, the shooting starts."

title: Facebook made the wrong decision: Talkspace CEO on why he ended partnership
text: Talkspace CEO Oren Frank joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss his decision to end its six figure partnership with Facebook.

title: Zuckerberg Defends Hands-Off Approach to Trump’s Posts
text: In a call with Facebook employees, who have protested the inaction on Mr. Trump’s messages, Mr. Zuckerberg said his decision was “pretty thorough.”

title: How Cameo, Facebook And Peloton Are Embracing Coronavirus Disruption
text: For most companies, the 2020 COVID-19 economic shutdown has been nothing short of disastrous for business.

title: Zuckerberg set to address criticism from employees over his actions amid civil unrest
text: Yahoo Finance’s Brian Sozzi, Alexis Christoforous, and Dan Howley discuss Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg’s reaction to employees criticizing his actions amid civil unrest.

title: Civil rights groups condemn Zuckerberg's inaction on Trump's posts
text: Civil rights leaders condemned Facebook's inaction on a recent series of controversial posts from President Donald Trump following a conversation Monday between their groups and top Facebook execs, including CEO Mark Zuckerberg and COO Sheryl Sandberg.

title: A $200 Billion Threat: Google, Facebook And Big Tech Gear Up For Summer Antitrust Battle
text: Analysts say antitrust probes into Facebook and Google could drive down the value of the companies by more than $200 billion.

title: Civil rights leaders say they're 'disappointed and stunned' after call with Facebook's Zuckerberg and Sandberg
text: The leaders said they were shocked by Zuckerberg's "incomprehensible explanations" for maintaining posts by President Donald Trump.

title: Facebook is taking employee virtual walkout very seriously, tech reporter says
text: Some Facebook employees staged a virtual walkout to protest CEO Mark Zuckerberg's decision to allow recent posts by President Trump to remain on the platform.

title: Civil rights leaders slam Facebook after meeting with Zuckerberg, says report
text: Unlike Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg has refused to remove or hide a tweet from the US president that says "when the looting starts, the shooting starts."
